snippet: The index, which compares the world’s 25 most populous countries by how big a problem they have with three types of worms, had some surprises.
abstract: Study published in journal PLoS Neglected Tropical Diseases highlights index created by scientists that ranks 25 most populous countries by severity of their health problems related to three types of worms; those nations are then compared against United Nations human development index; findings verify that poorest nations have widespread infestations.
lead_paragraph: The index, which compares the world’s 25 most populous countries by how big a problem they have with three types of worms, had some surprises.

headline.main: Tracking Worms Troubles to Monitor a Country’s Health
